data.title: Musicians Born on April 3
data.meta_description: Famous birthdays in music for the 3rd of April. See which composers, musicians, pop stars and rockers were born on April 3.
data.text:
Giovanni Battista Massarengo, Italian composer, born in Parma, Duchy of Parma (d. c.1596)

William Smith, British composer of Anglican sacred choral works, baptized in Durham, England (d. 1645)

Antimo Liberati, Italian composer, born in Foligno, Umbria, Papal States (d. 1692)

Joseph François Salomon, French composer, born in Toulon, France (d. 1732)

Johann Valentin Rathgeber, German organist, Benedictine priest, choirmaster, and composer (Augsburger Tafel-Confect), born in Oberelsbach, Electorate of Bavaria, Holy Roman Empire (d. 1750)

Jean-Baptiste Lemoyne, French opera composer, born in Eymet, France (d. 1796)

Ferenc Verseghy, Hungarian poet and composer, born in Szolnok, Hungary (d. 1822)

Adolf Rzepko, Polish composer, born in Prague, Kingdom of Bohemia (d. 1892)

Reginald De Koven, American operetta and popular song composer (Oh Promise Me), born in Middletown, Connecticut (d. 1920)

Mistinguett [Jeanne Florentine Bourgeois], French actress and singer (Moulin Rouge star), born in Enghien-les-Bains, Val-d'Oise, France (d. 1956)

Eduardo Sanchez de Fuentes, Cuban composer, born in Havana, Cuba (d. 1944)

(Arthur) "Dooley" Wilson, American piano player, singer, and actor (Casablanca; Stormy Weather; Beulah), born in Tyler, Texas (d. 1953)

Grigoras Dinicu, Romanian violin virtuoso and composer, born in Bucharest, Kingdom of Romania (d. 1949)

(Edward Elzear) "Zez" Confrey, American jazz pianist and composer ("Kitten on the Keys"; "Dizzy Fingers."), born in Peru, Illinois (d. 1971)

1895 Mario Castelnuovo-Tedesco, Italian composer, born in Florence, Italy (d. 1968)

George Jessel, American stage and screen actor, singer, producer and host known as "The Toastmaster General", born in New York City (d. 1981)

Henri Garat, French actor and singer (Les dieux s'amusent; Congress Dances), born in Paris, France (d. 1959)

1902 Siguringi Eirikur Hjorleifsson, Icelandic composer, born in Bergskot, Grindavík, Iceland (d. 1975)

James "Bubber" Miley, American jazz trumpet and cornet player (Duke Ellington, 1923-29 - "East St. Louis Toodle-Oo"; "Black And Tan Fantasy"), born in Aiken, South Carolina (d. 1932)

Peter Van Steeden, composer and orchestra leader (Break the Bank), born in Amsterdam, Netherlands (d. 1990)

1904 Sally Rand, American burlesque dancer, vedette, and actress known for her ostrich feather fan and balloon bubble dances, born in Elkton, Missouri (d. 1979)

Lili Kraus, Czech-Hungarian-British concert pianist and educator, born in Budapest, Hungary (d. 1986)

Walter "Fats" Pichon American jazz pianist, singer, and big bandleader, born in New Orleans, Louisiana (d. 1967)

Homesick James [Williamson], American blues slide guitarist and singer (Elmore James band, 1955-62), born in Somerville, Tennessee (d. 2006) [date of birth variously reported as 1905, 1910, and 1914; surname also disputed]

Watkins Shaw, British musicologist, born in Bradford, Yorkshire, England (d. 1996)

George Barati, American cellist, composer, and conductor (Honolulu Symphony, 1950-67), born in Győr, Hungary (d. 1996)

George Sopkin, American cellist (Fine Arts Quartet, 1941-79), and teacher, born in Chicago, Ilinois (d. 2008)

Ken Kersey, Canadian jazz pianist, and composer ("Boogie Woogie Cocktail"), born in Harrow, Ontario (d. 1983)

Bill Finegan, American pianist and big band arranger (Glenn Miller, Tommy Dorsey), composer and bandleader (Sauter-Finegan Orchestra), born in Newark, New Jersey (d. 2008)

1917 Tibor Andrasovan, Slovak composer, born in Slovenská Lupca, Zólyom, Austria-Hungary (d. 2001)

Enrique Iturriaga, Peruvian composer (Sinfonía Junín y Ayacucho), born in Lima, Peru (d. 2019)

1918 Louis Applebaum, Canadian conductor and composer, born in Toronto, Ontario (d. 2000)

1918 Sixten Ehrling, Swedish pianist, conductor (Royal Opera of Stockholm, 1953-60; Detroit Symphony, 1963-73), and educator (Juilliard, 1973-87), born in Malmö, Sweden (d. 2005)

Stan Freeman, American composer (Melody Tour), born in Waterbury, Connecticut (d. 2001)

Doris Day

American singer ("Sentimental Journey"; "Que Sera, Sera (Whatever Will Be, Will Be)"), actress (Pillow Talk; The Man Who Knew Too Much), animal welfare and AIDS activist, known as the "girl next door", born in Cincinnati, Ohio

Joseph Kerman, American educator and musicologist (Contemplating Music: Challenges to Musicology), born in London, England (d. 2014)

1924 Murray Dickie, Scottish opera singer and director, born in Bishopton, Glasgow, Scotland (d. 1995)

Pierre D'Archambeau, American concert violinist, born in Yverdon, Switzerland (d. 2014)

Don Gibson, American country musician and songwriter ("Sweet Dreams"; "I Can't Stop Loving You"), born in Shelby, North Carolina (d. 2003)

Jimmy McGriff, American jazz Hammond organist, born in Germantown, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania (d. 2008)

1936 Scott LaFaro, American jazz bassist (Bill Evans Trio), born in Irvington, New Jersey (d. 1961)

David Maves, American composer and educator, born in Salem, Oregon

1937 Louis Satterfield [also known as Lui-Lui, Ealee, and Sat], American trombone player (The Pharaohs, Earth, Wind & Fire, Phenix Horns), born in Shaw, Mississippi (d. 2004)

Jeff Barry [Joel Adelberg], American pop songwriter ("Do Wah Diddy Diddy"; "Da Doo Ron Ron"; "Chapel Of Love"; "Leader Of The Pack'), born in Brooklyn, New York

François de Roubaix, French film score composer, born in Neuilly-sur-Seine, France (d. 1975)

Jan Berry, American rock and roll vocalist (Jan and Dean - "Surf City"), born in Los Angeles, California (d. 2004)

1941 Philippé Wynne, American soul singer ("I'll Be Around"), born in Cincinnati, Ohio (d. 1984)

Billy Joe Royal, American country and pop singer ("Down in the Boondocks"), born in Valdosta, Georgia (d. 2015)

1942 Herbie Greene, American photographer best known for his portraits for rock and roll luminaries (The Grateful Dead), born in Indio, California

1942 Wayne Newton, American singer and entertainer (Daddy, Don't You Walk So Fast; Danke Schon), born in Norfolk, Virginia

Artie Traum, American folk guitarist, songwriter, producer, and filmmaker, born in The Bronx, New York (d. 2008)

1943 Mario Lavista, Mexican composer and writer, born in Mexico City (d. 2021)

1943 Richard Manuel, Canadian rock pianist and vocalist (The Band - "The Shape I'm In"; "Tears Of Rage"), born in Stratford, Ontario (d. 1986)

Barry Pritchard, British rock guitarist (Fortunes - "You've Got Your Troubles"; "Here It Comes Again"; "This Golden Ring"), born in Birmingham, England (d. 1999)

1944 Tony Orlando [Cassavitis], American pop singer (& Dawn - "Tie A Yellow Ribbon"; "Knock Three Times"), and television personality, born in New York City

(David) Dee Murray [Oates], British bassist (Elton John backing band), born in Gillingham, Kent, England (d. 1992)

1946 Stella Chiweshe, Zimbabwean musician and storyteller (Africa’s best-known female mbira player), born in Mujumi Village, Mhondoro, Rhodesia (d. 2023)

Anders Eliasson, Swedish contemporary classical composer, born in Borlänge, Sweden (d. 2013)

Garrick Ohlsson, American concert pianist (International Busoni winner, 1966; Chopin Prize, 1970), born in Bronxville, New York

Daniel Catán, Mexican composer (Rappaccini's Daughter; Florencia en el Amazonas), born in Mexico City (d. 2011)

1949 Eric Kloss, American jazz saxophonist, born in Greenville, Pennsylvania

1949 Greg Calbi, American mastering engineer (Eric Carmen; John Lennon; David Bowie; Bruce Springsteen), born in Yonkers, New York

1949 Jan Keizer, Dutch pop singer (BZN - "Rhythm of My Heart"), born in Volendam, Netherlands

1949 Richard Thompson, English singer-songwriter, and guitarist ("Tear-Stained Letter"; "1952 Vincent Black Lightning"), born in Notting Hill Gate, London

Curtis Stone, American country music bassist and mandolin player (Highway 101 - "Cry, Cry, Cry"), born in Hollywood, California

Dave Bronze, British session and touring bass player (Eric Clapton; Tom Jones; Robin Trower), born in Billercay, Essex, England

Craig Taubman, Jewish-American singer (Friday Night Live), born in Millington, Tennessee

1953 Huub van der Lubbe, Dutch rock singer (Stampei - The Dike), born in Amsterdam

1953 Pattie D'Arcy, American musical theater, session and touring vocalist (Cher), born in Orange, New Jersey (d. 2007)

Elisabetta Brusa, Italian-British composer (Simply Largo), and educator, born in Milan, Italy

John Mooney, American blues-funk guitarist, slide guitarist and singer (Bluesiana), born in East Orange, New Jersey

Miguel Bose, Panamanian-born Spanish singer and actor (El Avaro, Queen Margot), born in Panama City

Adam Gussow, American blues harmonic player (Satan & Adam), and college professor, born in New York City

Arjen Anthony Lucassen, Dutch progressive rock singer-songwriter, and musician (Ayreon), born in Hilversum, Netherlands

1960 Marie Denise Pelletier, Canadian pop singer (Entre la tête et le cœur), born in Montréal, Québec

Mike Ness, American punk rock singer-songwriter, and guitarist (Social Distortion), born in Lynn, Massachusetts

1962 Simon Raymonde, British bassist, songwriter, and record producer (Cocteau Twins), born in Lewisham, London, England

Criss Oliva, American musician (Savatage), born in Pompton Plains, New Jersey (d. 1993)

1963 Tsuyoshi Sekito, Japanese video game composer, born in Osaka, Japan

Nazia Hassan, Pakistani pop singer-songwriter, lawyer and social activist known as "Queen of Pop" in South Asia, born in Karachi, Sindh, Pakistan (d. 2000)

Sebastian Bach [Bierk], Canadian heavy metal singer (Skid Row - "I Remember You"; "Psycho Love"), born in Freeport, Bahamas

Jeremy Huw Williams, Welsh baritone opera singer, born in Cardiff, Wales

Kelly Price, American R&B and gospel vocalist ("Friend of Mine"), born in Queens, New York

Drew Shirley, American Christian-rock guitarist (All Together Separate; Switchfoot, 2003-present), born in Key West, Florida

Aaron Bertram, American ska trumpeter (Suburban Legends, 1998-2005), and children's music educator (Kids Imagine Nation), born in Lubbock, Texas

Fler [Patrick Losensky], German rapper, born in Berlin, Germany

Leona Lewis

English pop singer-songwriter ("Bleeding Love"; "Better In Time"), born in Islington, London

Julie Sokolow, American film director and musician, born in Holmdel, New Jersey

1987 Rachel Bloom, American actress, writer, and singer-songwriter (Crazy Ex-Girlfriend), born in Los Angeles county, California

Young M.A

American rapper (Ooouuu), born in New York City

BONZIE [Nina Ferraro], American indie rock singer-songwriter and musician, born in Racine, Wisconsin

Sam Kiszka, American bass player (Greta Van Fleet), born in Frankenmuth, Michigan

Matthew Whitaker, American jazz pianist and Hammond B-3 organ player (Outta The Box), born in Hackensack, New Jersey
